name: imprudence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being unwise, because you fail to consider the possible results of your actions: The board hopes these decisions will expose any imprudence or dishonesty. He believes that a time of surplus is a time of greater government imprudence. See
imprudent
More examplesFewer examplesPeople must suffer the consequences of their own imprudence.The imprudence of his actions speaks for itself.The company was found to have caused the death of the tourist through imprudence, negligence, and violation of the safety guidelines.
